meanings.definition: A genre of music that combines traditional rhythms and instruments from around the world.
meanings.sent1: The concert was filled with the vibrant sounds of worldbeat.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy listening to worldbeat music for its unique blend of cultures.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone couldn't resist dancing to the catchy worldbeat tunes.
meanings.sent4: Her heart danced to the worldbeat of the drums, feeling connected to distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The worldbeat melodies transported the listeners to far-off places in their minds.

meanings.definition: The global music scene that incorporates diverse cultural influences.
meanings.sent1: In the world of music, worldbeat represents a fusion of different traditions.
meanings.sent2: Artists from around the globe contribute to the rich tapestry of worldbeat.
meanings.sent3: The festival celebrated the colorful worldbeat that unites people through rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her playlist was a journey through the worldbeat of various cultures, a true musical mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The radio station played a mix of worldbeat tracks, showcasing the beauty of diversity in music.

meanings.definition: To dance or move to the rhythm of worldbeat music.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but worldbeat to the lively song playing on the radio.
meanings.sent2: The crowd began to worldbeat as soon as the band started their worldbeat set.
meanings.sent3: He worldbeat across the dance floor, matching his steps to the infectious worldbeat tune.
meanings.sent4: The music was so infectious that it made everyone want to worldbeat together.
meanings.sent5: As the worldbeat rhythm filled the room, she felt the urge to get up and dance along.
